snippet: An astrobiologist who noticed globules that might have been water on a Mars lander in 2008 demonstrates that small amounts of water may be forming on the planet today.
abstract: Dr Nilton O Renno study in journal Geophysical Research Letters suggests that small globules in pictures taken by Mars lander Phoenix could be water and that small amounts of water could be still be forming on Mars.
lead_paragraph: An astrobiologist who noticed globules that might have been water on a Mars lander in 2008 demonstrates that small amounts of water may be forming on the planet today.

headline.main: Recreating Mars in a Lab, and Finding Water
headline.print_headline: The Solar System: Recreating Mars in a Lab, and Finding Water
